drupalNodeEvent.title: Visualising the Invisible: The Maps and Charts that Shaped the Seascape of China in the Long Eighteenth Century

field_speakers.processed: Dr. Ronald C. Po (Associate Professor of Department of International History, London School of Economics and Political Science)

field_description.processed: Dr Ronald C. Po, Department of International History at The London School of Economics and Political Science, focuses on the history of late imperial China, realm of maritime and global studies. He will be presenting on the topic of "Visualising the Invisible: The Maps and Charts that Shaped the Seascape of China in the Long Eighteenth Century". This event will be held both face-to-face and on Zoom.
